meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's Time to Get This Purr-fectly Good Review Started!

I'm thrilled to dive into the whimsical world of Cat Quest, a delightful action RPG that will have you purr-ing with joy. With its adorable feline protagonist and cat-titude-filled humor, this game is sure to bring a smile to your face.

As I explored the mystical realm, I found myself in stitches thanks to the endless stream of cat puns (I mean, who doesn't love a good "paw-some" or "whisker-ific"?). But beyond the LOL moments, Cat Quest offers solid RPG action and an engaging quest structure that's easy to pick up and play.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But what about the critics?" Well, let me tell you - I'm not afraid of a little criticism (after all, I'm a grog reviewer with wit). So, I'll give you the lowdown on what the other critics had to say:

Worth Playing gave Cat Quest 78 points, praising its "cute visuals" and solid RPG action. They noted that it's best enjoyed in short bursts to avoid repetition.

Nintendo Life also dished out a score of 70, but with some caveats: they loved the game's charm and polish, but found the cat-centric focus might not be everyone's cup of tea (I mean, what about dog lovers?).

SpazioGames took it down a notch with a 60-point review, citing excessive simplification of mechanics and short longevity. Ouch! But hey, at least it's accessible to new players, right?

The other critics - NintendoWorldReport (70 points), God is a Geek (80 points), Cubed3 (70 points), and Digitally Downloaded (60 points) - all had similar praise for the game's charm and humor.

In conclusion, Cat Quest is a delightful adventure that will have you meow-ving to its whimsical world. It may not be perfect, but with its lighthearted tone and engaging gameplay, it's a great choice for anyone looking for a fun RPG experience. So go ahead, give it a try - your inner cat lover (or outer) will thank you!
